How to Install legit on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • legit

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install legit on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing legit on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall legit in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install legit, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install legit Using apt

To install legit in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install legit using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install legit

The installation of legit might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install legit Using apt-get

To install legit using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install legit.

sudo apt-get -y install legit

Install legit Using Synaptic

To install legit using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install legit on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for legit. This will display the legit package in the package window, now to install legit, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the legit package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of legit.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install legit Using aptitude

To install legit on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of legit.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install legit using the command aptitude install legit.

sudo aptitude -y install legit

How to Upgrade legit on debian

If you want to upgrade the legit package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade legit using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade legit to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade legit.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade legit sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade legit

Upgrade legit using Aptitude

To upgrade legit using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade legit.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade legit

Upgrade legit using Synaptic

To upgrade legit using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for legit, now right-click legit, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade legit just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall legit on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall legit from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just legit, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove legit

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of legit

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of legit you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge legit

Remove legit using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall legit using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for legit, right-click the legit package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall legit click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install legit on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade legit using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.
